questions.a: Elim G Mission is a glocal mission organization working with migrants living in Korea. We go beyond simple help to create sustainable relationships and connections, serving as a bridge in all areas: church, workplace, school, and life.

Donations are transparently used for migrant worship and community operations (40%), Korean language education and self-reliance support (30%), life support such as medical and legal counseling (20%), and mission infrastructure construction (10%). Quarterly financial reports are published on the website.

We recruit volunteers in various fields including Korean language education, interpretation, IT support, legal counseling, and medical support. Please contact us via KakaoTalk channel or email for consultation.

questions.q: Which countries' migrants do you work with?
questions.a: We work with migrants from 18 Southeast Asian countries including Vietnam, Nepal, Cambodia, Laos, Thailand, Myanmar, Philippines, and Indonesia. We primarily serve foreign workers, marriage migrants, and international students.

Our headquarters is in Gimhae, Gyeongnam, and we minister mainly in Gyeongnam and Busan areas including Gijang, Jeongguan, Geoje, Changwon, and Jinju. You can participate from anywhere in the country through online platforms.
